HEA_composition.research_system: Pt-based quinary HEAs (microscale arrays + CNF-loaded catalysts)

form.screening_stage: microscale HEAs printed on glassy carbon (GC)
form.validation_stage: HEAs loaded on CO2-activated carbon nanofibers (CNFs)

HEA_composition.crystal_structure: FCC single-phase solid solution (both microscale HEAs and HEAs@CNFs)

synthesis.precursors: metal chloride salts (printed as mixed precursor droplets)
synthesis.substrate: glassy carbon (GC) for screening; CO2-activated carbon nanofibers for validation
synthesis.outcome: complete decomposition of metal chlorides (no Cl detected by EDS)

SEM.microscale_HEAs: dense surface structure with no visible phase segregation

XRD.HEAs@CNFs: single-phase FCC for all three top combinations

HAADF_STEM_EDS_HEAs_CNF.distribution: homogeneous mixing of all elements in each nanoparticle

ICP_OES.finding: element ratios of HEAs@CNFs are consistent with microscale HEAs

screening_method.descriptor: j_relative = i / i_charging (used as intrinsic activity proxy)

high_throughput_results.ranking_consistency: similar activity ranking at 0.10–0.25 V vs RHE
high_throughput_results.reproducibility: parallel synthesis of FeNiCuCoPt shows overlapping j_relative–E curves

theoretical_computations.surface_model: FCC (111) slabs for FeNiCuCoPt, FeNiCoSnPt, FeNiCuSnPt
theoretical_computations.active_site: Fe sites identified as primary ORR active centers

O2_adsorption.trend: FeNiCuCoPt shows strongest O2 adsorption among three
O2_adsorption.correlation: adsorption ranking matches experimental activity ranking

electronic_structure.d_band_center: shifts toward Fermi level with composition tuning
electronic_structure.synergy: Cu–Co interaction promotes favorable electronic environment at Fe sites
electronic_structure.charge_transfer: Fe in FeNiCuCoPt transfers more electrons to O2

reaction_pathway.best_performance: FeNiCuCoPt shows highest limiting voltage and lowest barrier
